text.p: These are the leading stories in the Algerian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Security forces "annihilate a gang of 32 terrorists" after the massacre of 30 people in Chebli, south of Algiers.
- Algeria celebrates Eid al-Adha hoping for peace.
- President Liamine Zeroual has issued an order over parliamentary elections urging politicians to "build together" a better future.
- The government organises a seminar on pharmaceutical trade with aim of cutting prices.
- Political parties still struggling to prepare candidate lists for the June 5 parliamentary elections.
- Ain Lachyakh town hall deputy mayor killed last Sunday near Blida, south of Algiers, by gunmen at roadblock. Two other persons were assassinated in Tizi-Ouzou region last Tuesday.
